verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> <S%H8764><s%>, Maschil <S%H4905><s%> <S%H8688><s%>, for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Korach <S%H7141><s%>. As the hart <S%H354><s%> panteth <S%H6165><s%> <S%H8799><s%> after the water <S%H4325><s%> brooks <S%H650><s%>, so panteth <S%H6165><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> after thee, O 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.

My soul <S%H5315><s%> thirsteth <S%H6770><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, for the living <S%H2416><s%> 'Elohim <S%H410><s%>: when shall I come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and appear <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8735><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> ?

My tears <S%H1832><s%> have been my meat <S%H3899><s%> day <S%H3119><s%> and night <S%H3915><s%>, while they continually <S%H3117><s%> say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%> unto me, Where is thy 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> ?

When I remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8799><s%> these things, I pour out <S%H8210><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> in me: for I had gone <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8799><s%> with the multitude <S%H5519><s%>, I went <S%H1718><s%> <S%H8691><s%> with them to the house <S%H1004><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, with the voice <S%H6963><s%> of joy <S%H7440><s%> and praise <S%H8426><s%>, with a multitude <S%H1995><s%> that kept holyday <S%H2287><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.

Why art thou cast down <S%H7817><s%> <S%H8709><s%>, O my soul <S%H5315><s%>? and why art thou disquieted <S%H1993><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in me? hope <S%H3176><s%> <S%H8685><s%> thou in 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: for I shall yet praise <S%H3034><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him for the help <S%H3444><s%> of his countenance <S%H6440><s%>.

O my 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>, my soul <S%H5315><s%> is cast down <S%H7817><s%> <S%H8709><s%> within me: therefore will I remember <S%H2142><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee from the land <S%H776><s%> of Yarden <S%H3383><s%>, and of the Hermonites <S%H2769><s%>, from the hill <S%H2022><s%> Mizar <S%H4706><s%>.

Deep <S%H8415><s%> calleth <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8802><s%> unto deep <S%H8415><s%> at the noise <S%H6963><s%> of thy waterspouts <S%H6794><s%>: all thy waves <S%H4867><s%> and thy billows <S%H1530><s%> are gone <S%H5674><s%> <S%H8804><s%> over me.

Yet the YY <S%H3068><s%> will command <S%H6680><s%> <S%H8762><s%> his lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> in the daytime <S%H3119><s%>, and in the night <S%H3915><s%> his song <S%H7892><s%> shall be with me, and my prayer <S%H8605><s%> unto the 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> of my life <S%H2416><s%>.

I will say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> my rock <S%H5553><s%>, Why hast thou forgotten <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me? why go <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8799><s%> I mourning <S%H6937><s%> <S%H8802><s%> because of the oppression <S%H3906><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%> ?

As with a sword <S%H7524><s%> in my bones <S%H6106><s%>, mine enemies <S%H6887><s%> <S%H8802><s%> reproach <S%H2778><s%> <S%H8765><s%> me; while they say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%> daily <S%H3117><s%> unto me, Where is thy 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> ?

Why art thou cast down <S%H7817><s%> <S%H8709><s%>, O my soul <S%H5315><s%>? and why art thou disquieted <S%H1993><s%> <S%H8799><s%> within me? hope <S%H3176><s%> <S%H8685><s%> thou in 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: for I shall yet praise <S%H3034><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him, who is the health <S%H3444><s%> of my countenance <S%H6440><s%>, and my 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>.
